intro: Lycianthes ciliolata var. pratorum, commonly known as the Mexican beautyberry, is a shrub native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in the spring and summer. The plant produces bright red, fleshy berries that are edible for some animals but generally not for humans. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in dry to semi-arid environments. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
